title.narrative: Basic Academic and professional School (EPP) Caxito , team 2012

description.narrative: Goal Overview: To offer Angolan youth a lower secondary education through which they acquire academic and practical skills, as well as general knowledge and life skills to enable them to become productive citizens, able to create a good life for themselves and their families and to contribute to the development of the country

Project Plan: The first year of the EPP program is a basic year, during which the students learn the academic subjects at 7th grade level through untraditional pedagogical methods link-ing theory with daily life and practice in the professions, learn to work in a group, to carry out investigations in the community, to speak in public and much more, and also try their hand at three professions, namely Community Health Agent, Food Producer, and Environment Pro-moter. During the second and third year the students will specialize in one of the three professions offered at EPP Caxito, which are: Energy Assistant, Food Producer, and Modern Cook.

Summary: : In cooperation with the Ministry of Education, ADPP is launching a new type of education in Angola: Basic Academic and Technical Education, known as EPP. The three year courses will combine regular schooling with vocational subjects and successful students will graduate with a nationally recognized academic and vocational certificate, corresponding to 9th grade. On graduation they will be able to continue to the next level of education (upper secondary) or find employment / start their own enterprise.
Target Groups: The direct target group consists of 70 young people, 12 – 18 years of age, from all municipalities in Bengo province, who have concluded primary school.
